publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4564 Carolyn Leckie: Welcome Lanarkshire Health United—That the Parliament welcomes Lanarkshire Health United to the Parliament on 15 June 2006 to protest against the decision of NHS Lanarkshire to exclude the option of improving and enhancing the status quo from its consultation and final options for the organisation of acute health services in Lanarkshire; recognises that the majority of people in Lanarkshire wish to keep both elective and emergency services together at their local hospital; believes that NHS Lanarkshire has arrogantly disregarded their views, and believes that the Executive should refer back any recommendations by NHS Lanarkshire to ensure a proper examination of the "status quo plus" and proper analysis of the steps necessary to deliver such an option in full and proper engagement with the public. Supported by: Rosie Kane*, Colin Fox*, Tommy Sheridan*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*

S2M-4564 Carolyn Leckie: Welcome Lanarkshire Health United—That the Parliament welcomes Lanarkshire Health United to the Parliament on 15 June 2006 to protest against the decision of NHS Lanarkshire to exclude the option of improving and enhancing the status quo from its consultation and final options for the organisation of acute health services in Lanarkshire; recognises that the majority of people in Lanarkshire wish to keep both elective and emergency services together at their local hospital; believes that NHS Lanarkshire has arrogantly disregarded their views, and believes that the Executive should refer back any recommendations by NHS Lanarkshire to ensure a proper examination of the "status quo plus" and proper analysis of the steps necessary to deliver such an option in full and proper engagement with the public. Supported by: Rosie Kane, Colin Fox, Tommy Sheridan, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Chris Ballance*, Frances Curran*
S2M-4564 Welcome Lanarkshire Health United (lodged on 15 June 2006) Margaret Mitchell*
